Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with part of bowl; cream slip; interior: glazed streaky black with band of alternating red and white tongues around central red and white rosette; exterior: glazed band on bottom of bowl; reserved band above junction with foot; foot glazed streaky black; near bottom of sherd, part of ray pattern with white dots between rays; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Decorated chalice feet are rare. For other decorated Chalice Style feet, see Lemos nos 1200 and 1201 from Gordion. See also British Museum 1924, 1201.561 and 1965,0930.472.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 748, pl. XXI, no. 748)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 399)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 35, no. 70, pl. XVII, no. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1194) (phase 2)
